item.description:
Below is the 2016 Request for Proposals (also known as a solicitation notice) for the National Environmental Education and Training Program.

  • 2016 Environmental Education Training Program Request for Proposals (PDF)(27 pp, 511 K, 3/15/2016)
item.dc:creator: eselia

item.title: National Environmental Education Advisory Council 2015 Report to the Administrator
item.description:
As one of the primary duties under its charter, the NEEAC is tasked with providing independent recommendations to the EPA Administrator to inform the Agency's strategic vision and enhance activities on environmental education. In October 2015, the most recent report of the National Environmental Education Advisory Council was sent to the EPA Adminstrator.

Overview of the 2015 Report

In this report, the NEEAC reviews the current challenges and opportunities across the environmental education field and provides a resource for both EPA and the broader environmental community to further the effectiveness and availability of environmental education.

The recommendations from the NEEAC focus on three key action areas for EPA: engagement, leadership and funding. These areas are supported by the work of the Office of Environmental Education to champion, to collaborate and to communicate about EE within the Agency and beyond.

  • Factsheet for the 2015 Report of the National Environmental Education Advisory Council.pdf (PDF)(2 pp, 313 K, 10/8/2015)
  • 2015 Report of the National Environmental Education Advisory Council (PDF)(68 pp, 7 MB, 10/1/2015)
item.dc:creator: eselia

item.title: Order EE Publications from EPA Region 5
item.description:
If you're NOT in Region 5

Nearly all these documents are available from EPA's National Service Center for Environmental Publications (NSCEP). Click on any of the linked titles below to view the item in NSCEP. You can download them and print them yourself or you can order multiple copies of most publications from NSCEP.

EPA's Chicago office provides printed curriculum materials to educators and students free of charge.

  1. EPA's Chicago office can only fill orders from the following states: Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Ohio and Wisconsin.
  2. Due to high demand and budget constraints we have limited copies of each publication. You may request multiple copies in the Comment field in the order form.

How to order publications from EPA Region 5

  1. Online - Fill out the online order form below.
  2. By mail - Mail your request to:
    Publications
    U.S. EPA Region 5
    Air and Radiation Division (AT-18J)
    Chicago, IL 60604
  3. By phone - Call 312-886-0274 or 800-621-8431 extension 60274 in IL, IN, MI, MN, OH, and WI.

Please allow 2 weeks for delivery.

Why is Coco Orange? (EPA 456K10001) 2012 
Colorful book on how Coco and his friends solve this mystery as they learn about air quality and how to protect themselves when the air is unhealthy. This book is for children, especially those with asthma, and their caretakers. Ages 4-8. (Elementary)

 Adventures of the Garbage Gremlin (EPA 530SW90024) 1990
comic book emphasizing importance of recycling (Elementary)

Pack A Waste-Free Lunch (EPA 530H05002) 2005
A poster on how to pack an environmentally friendly lunch. (Elementary or Secondary)

 Climate Change & You: What You Can Do at School EPA 430F07007) 2007
A single sheet of 5 points you can apply to make schools more energy efficient. (Curriculum)
Happy Earth Day Coloring and Activities Book (EPA 905M90002) 1990
Popular coloring book emphasizes things kids can do every day to help the earth. (Elementary)

25 Ways that YOU can help to Make Your World a Better Place
mini poster outlining steps you can take to become more environmentally friendly. (Curriculum)

The Life Cycle of a Soccer Ball
Large, informative and colorful two-sided poster on the life cycle of a soccer ball. (Elementary or Secondary)

 

Climate Change Art Challenge Poster: A Resource for Educators 2010 
The poster, geared towards 6-8 grade teachers, includes information on the effects of climate change, climate change vocabulary, actions you can take against climate change, and activities. Please indicate number of posters (up to 25) in the comment section of the order form. (Curriculum)

The Life Cycle of a CD or DVD (EPA 530H03002) 2003
Large, informative and colorful two-sided poster on the product life cycle of CDs & DVDs; with student activities and related websites. (Elementary or Secondary)

Environmental Protection Begins with You (EPA 530K06001) July 2006
A Guide to Environmental Community Service
(Curriculum)

Science Fair Fun: Designing Environmental Science Projects for Students Grades 6-8 (EPA 530K10002) 2010
overview of the scientific method, sample project ideas for students and teachers (Elementary or Secondary)

  

Order Form
item.dc:creator: kreshkin

item.title: Magnificent Ground Water Connection
item.description:
The Magnificent Ground Water Connection was developed in cooperation with EPA by the New England Interstate Water Pollution Control Commission. It is a compilation of some of the best ground water-related activities from previously existing curricula, seasoned with a collection of original materials and geared specifically to New England.

  • Grades K-6: All the Water in the World (PDF)(5 pp, 96 K)
  • Grades 4-6: The Case of the Disappearing Water (PDF)(6 pp, 58 K)
  • Grades 3-6: Deep Subjects - Wells and Ground Water (PDF)(9 pp, 293 K)
  • Grades K-6: Excuse Me, Is This the Way to the Drainpipe? (PDF)(11 pp, 217 K)
  • Grades 4-6: The Case of the Mysterious Renters (PDF)(6 pp, 79 K)
  • All Lessons for Grades K-6 (PDF)(37 pp, 652 K)
  • Grades 7-12: The Water Cycle and Water Conservation - Getting up to Speed (PDF)(3 pp, 87 K)
  • Grades 7-12: The Water Cycle and Water Conservation - All the Water in the World (PDF)(3 pp, 49 K)
  • Grades 7-12: The Water Cycle and Water Conservation - How Much Water Do You Use? (PDF)(7 pp, 71 K)
  • Grades 7-12: New England's Ground Water Resources - Getting Up to Speed (PDF)(10 pp, 241 K)
  • Grades 7-12: New England's Ground Water Resources - Predicting Ground Water Flow (PDF)(6 pp, 82 K)
  • Grades 7-12: New England's Ground Water Resources - The Great Water Hook-Up (PDF)(6 pp, 60 K)
  • Grades 7-12: Ground Water Contamination - Getting Up to Speed (PDF)(10 pp, 209 K)
  • Grades 7-12: Ground Water Contamination - "A Civil Action" (PDF)(1 pg, 29 K)
  • Grades 7-12: Ground Water Contamination - When You Were My Age, What Was This Place Like? (PDF)(3 pp, 32 K)
  • Grades 7-12: Protecting Ground Water - Getting Up to Speed (PDF)(11 pp, 121 K)
  • Grades 7-12: Protecting Ground Water - Develop a Wellhead Protection Program (PDF)(9 pp, 91 K)
  • All Lessons for Grades 7-12 (PDF)(70 pp, 849 K)
